channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024030265
item.description:
Report X-2024030265

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX LEFT OUTSIDE OF HWPA, BAGGED, IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: ONE OF 4 BOTTLES MISSING CAP. NOT RECOVERED WITH DAMAGED CONTENTS OR PACKAGING. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP HOLE COVERED WITH A NITRILE GLOVE AT THE OPENING AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED. ENTIRE BOTTLE WAS LAYERED IN SHRINK WRAP. BOXES WERE PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED. ALL DAMAGED PACKAGING AND ALL CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED.

item.title: Report E-2024030224
item.description:
Report E-2024030224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1719 was crushed in transit due to lack of dunnage and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel collected the damaged pail for disposal. The crew deployed Portland cement to the trailer interior and restacked the undamaged freight for further shipment. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA when package handler realized the top of the bucket was wet and leaking. DescribePack: The bucket was leaking through the small cap on the lid. This cap was not properly sealed correctly because it was seal at a crooked angle. Cap won't move due to the crooked angle and will still leak if corrosive liquid reach the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bucket was taken to QA and placed in a black tub for hazmat.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 11, 2024, one (1) 40-pound bag of calcium peroxide was punctured by a forklift and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized hand tools to sweep up the released product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. HES personnel removed the damaged bag from the shipment and placed it into the same drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

All of the contents leaked out. DescribePack: There entire glass bottle shattered due to improperly packing of contents. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to damage area for further inspected by trained personnel. The box was places in a red hazmat tote lined with a bag to reduce the release of the liquids.

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car was observed during a shove to the hump with ice on the protective housing and vapor visible. Upon inspection, the A end liquid valve was encapsulated in ice and the plug was laying on the pressure plate unsecured and the valve was partially open. The valve was closed, and the odor dissipated. The ice was melted with water, the valve inspected, and no issue found. The plug was properly secured and after a few minutes the valve was checked with snoop and no issues or releases were found. No other issues were found, and the housing was secured with a seal and released back into transportation.

item.title: Report X-2024030580
item.description:
Report X-2024030580

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONSIBLE MANAGEMENT PERSON DIRECTED THIS DESIGNATED RESPONDER TO RETRIEVE A WET PACKAGE FROM DOOR 24. RESPONDER RETRIEVED PACKAGE AND DETERMINED THE PACKAGE WAS COMPROMISED DUE TO RAINWATER. AFTER VERIFYING THE CONTENTS OF COMPROMISED PACKAGE, RESPONDER SAW THAT THE INNER PACKAGING HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND LABEL ON EACH BOX. CHECKED THE OUTSIDE OF THE ORIGINAL BOX AND DID NOT FIND ANY DECLARATION OF A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL. ADVISED RMP. RMP CONTACTED THE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SERVICE CENTER. AFTER SPEAKING WITH HMSC, DIRECTED TO INPUT THE PACKAGE AS A POSSIBLE UNDECLARED INTO THE ELECTRONIC TRACKING AND TRACING SYSTEM.

  • City: GREENSBORO

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE WAS WET DUE TO BAGS OF ICE INSIDE THE BOX THAT HAD MELTED COMPROMISING THE INTEGRITY OF THE BOX. THE REGULAR ICE WAS COOLING 24 X 13 OUNCE AEROSOLS CANS OF FAVORITE DAY WHIPPED DAIRY TOPPING. THE CAN INDICATES THE CONTENTS ARE UNDER PRESSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024030242
item.description:
Report X-2024030242

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We were called to trailer#822984 in the unload upon it being opened, for a presumed leaking hazmat. When we arrived, we found the hazmat loaded into the trailer upside down and above waist height, it was spilling all over the packages below it and spilled into the belly of the pup as well. All trk #'s above are pkgs that were damaged by this spill, they will be held until I get the disposition back for this incident. Hazmat spill protocol was followed, and all items are stored in Haz cage, spill was cleaned up and ph9'd cleanup supplies are in cage with damaged hazmat as well. Hazmat itself was placed in a hazardous materials tote lined with a bag and is on the corrosive pallet in the Haz cage. DescribePack: The pkg being upside down when loaded more than likely ruined the seal on the bucket. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cleaned up and followed Haz spill protocol.

item.title: Report E-2024030194
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 5, 2024, one (!) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was cracked during loading and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and sodium bicarbonate to remediate the UN2922-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal ULX experienced a UN1727 Ammonium Biflouride release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bag and released material were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining bags were re-stacked and secured for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024030231
item.description:
Report X-2024030231

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the contents were discovered being coded for a refusal at the station for being damaged, we discovered that the contents (Which were 2 2.5-gallon jugs of liquid machine detergent which was a hazmat under UN 1760 Corrosive liquids N.O.S. Technical name Sodium Hydroxide) have leaked a small amount of the contents out of the package. Some of the box is wet due on the exterior but that is rain that has soaked a portion of the packaging. Upon closure inspection the caps were loose, and the corrosive liquids were observed to originate at the affected area. None of the liquid contents from inside of the package has been released out of the box, but still leaked from the inner jugs. No inner packing was found inside of the package. DescribePack: The Jugs were observed to have no leaks upon discovery, but some of the liquid inside of the container was out of the container and was at the time of discovery staining the inner exterior box. The caps enclosing the jugs containing the corrosive solution were observed to be loose with the most recently escaped liquid appearing right below the cap. The caps on the containers were promptly tightened and no leaks were observed after test and observing for a leak. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Upon awareness of the damaged hazmat, the caps were tightened prevent any further leaks.

  • Description: On March 4, 2024, ten (10) one-gallon pails of paint related material were crushed in transit and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the truck interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH utilized absorbents to recover the spilled product from the impacted trailer floor. All waste was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for future disposal. LSH repalletized the undamaged freight for continued shipping.

  • City: PARSIPPANY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CONTENTS OF A NEXT DAY AIR PACKAGE WERE INSPECTED DUE TO THE OUTER BOX BEING MARKED AS FROZEN BAKED GOODS AND BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY EIGHT POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FROZEN BAKED GOODS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THERE IS A YELLOW THERM-O-CHILL OVERNITE SHIPPERS POLAR TECH INDUSTRIES INC STICKER APPLIED. OUTER BOX IS A THERMO CHILL INSULATED SHIPPERS BOX PREPRINTED RUSH AND PERISHABLE WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a battery acid release from a 1750-pound UN2794 battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 20’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading/pallet failure. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted area. The battery was up righted and re-secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbents, pallet wood, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024020449

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: Nashville
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/20/24, at 1316 hours, personnel in the CSXT Radnor Yard discovered TILX270130, a loaded tank car of Hexamethylenediamine, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and shipper, Ascend Performance Materials, were notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2024-02-20-00151). Marion Environmental Inc., a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found 4 of the 4 liquid valve mounting flange bolts were less than tool tight. MEI personnel tightened the flange bolts to secure the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Tara Gardner, tgardn@ascendmaterials.com, 256-552-2528). The car was held at Radnor pending further repair and qualification by certified repair unit.

item.title: Report E-2024030055
item.description:
Report E-2024030055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of the concrete floor and estimated that two (2) pints of material was released due to puncture of one (1) 330- gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. The contractor transferred the remaining material into a new poly tote. The damaged poly tote and spent absorbents were containerized into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The new poly tote and generated drums of waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

  • City: HORSE CAVE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck and trailer with hazardous waste load on a van trailer were in route. This load contained metal drums of waste flammable liquid. Driver stopped to take a break at a rest area in KY and discovered that there was a leak coming from the rear of the trailer. Local Fire Dept and Police were dispatched to the scene. An emergency response company was also retained and dispatched to the scene for response and clean up. For precaution the Fire Department evacuated the rest area. Upon investigation it was determined that one of the metal drums had been punctured and had leaked out inside the trailer and them some had leaked from the rear of the trailer onto the ground. The trailer was unloaded and decontaminated and the punctured drum was placed in an overpack and loaded back onto the trailer along with the other drums. The response crew also cleaned up the small amount that reached the ground. All waste was placed back on the trailer and transported to destination.

item.title: Report X-2024030578
item.description:
Report X-2024030578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CN RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Sunday, Febuary 25, 2024, a CN mechanical performing an inspection observed that the bottom outlet valve appeared to be leaking from tank car # GBRX 703408 along with a strong Ethanol type odor in the area. The employee notified the Transportation Manager who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The tank car was set out to an isolation track (WA90) for inspection by a CN emergency response contractor. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The contractor performed an inspection of the tank car and found the bottom outlet valve to be leaking from the threads of the bottom outlet valve cap. It was determined that there was a failure in the sealing surface of the valve seat to include a defective gasket. (The BOV cap was found to be tool tight and the BOV in the closed position and pinned upon initial inspection). CN emergency response contractor did observe cable seal to be correctly in place. The BOV valve handle was cycled several times to the open and closed position to free any debris that may have been trapped in the BOV sealing surface potentially causing the leak. The BOV cap was then removed and observed for 20 minutes to ensure there was no further leakage from the valve. It was noted that the BOV cap gasket was deformed and was replaced. The bottom outlet valve cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench. Upon tightening the BOV cap, CN emergency response contractor proceeded to place new cable seals on the BOV / Cap.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had arrived to our station in a damp state. QA and management team isolated the package due to potential damage. Upon inspection, it appears that their are 4 bottles of hydrogen peroxide that had loose caps and inadequate inner packaging for transportation. This caused the contents to spill in the fiberboard box. DescribePack: Package failure was due to the hydrogen peroxide bottles having loose caps and inadequate inner packaging for transportation. This caused a spill at the bottom of the fiberboard box. The spilled contents stayed within the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Management team placed clear bags and absorbent pads around the leaking package. After the spill was contained, management team placed the damaged HazMat inside of a red HazMat bin and placed the package inside of the HazMat cage for further processing.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Post-incident inspection revealed a malfunctioning vapor recovery system on the 87E10 storage tank at the delivery location. The spill was the result of the delivery driver improperly disconnecting the delivery coupling while the system was pressurized. The pressure equalized after 4-5 minutes and the overfill subsided. Local EMS responded as did a professional response team to mitigate the effects of the release. The released gasoline entered the stormwater retention basin at the delivery site and just into the outflow area on the property. The spill did not leave the premises. No surface water or ground water was impacted.

  • Description: X-2024030161: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found with Class 8 label, fully regulated markings and paperwork in lined red tote on HMPA staging pallet. Ftrack shows OVH scan at NASH on 2/24/24, 16:14. Spidr shows potential damage as early as 2/24, 15:08. NO UNPOP RATING FOUND ON INNER CONTAINERS DESPITE "OVERPACK" LABEL FOUND ON OUTER PACKAGING. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN ELOU. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY.   • Description: SequenceEvent: The Damaged Hazmat came down the sorter onto the flex. The package was discovered to be wet from the side of the package. The package was then placed into a red bin and Hazmat bag to be properly worked on. DescribePack: The package when discovered had a wet spot on the side of the box about 3 inches in length. Upon opening the package, it was viewed to be caused by a loose cap on one of the bottles of Zep Liquid heat. The loose cap leaked out liquid onto itself, another bottle, and the box. The loose cap had loose play to it compared to the others which had a tightly placed cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red bin and hazmat bag in case any of its contents continued to leak. The package was also placed up in accordance with its load arrows to prevent any more spillage.

  • Description: On February 28, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1206 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1206-impacted trailer. All impacted material was collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.description:

  • City: LAREDO

  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 5, 2024 at 1213 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons KEROPUR AP 205-20, UN1307 3, III from (1) 55-gallon DM. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by a puncture from a nail and was contained to a small area on the trailer floor and a 2’ x 2’ area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drum with product was placed in an 85-gallon overpack DM. All waste generated from addressing this release, was containerized in (1) 5-gallon poly drum, and (1) 85-gallon overpack DM, which was then staged onsite by the contractors for proper disposal.

  • Description: On February 29, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of Xylene (UN1307) was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel deployed granular absorbents to the xylene-impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. ISR personnel transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote into a new one. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On February 29, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1789 was crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior, tires, and asphalt parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. PES crews utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads on the impacted trailer and tires. The deployed granular absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. Crews deployed a neutralizing solution onto the impacted asphalt and worked them in with hand tools. All UN1789-impacted material was collected and containerized into the previously generated 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024030019
item.description:
Report I-2024030019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer to fill a Ammonia Tank. He verified everything on the BulldMiniBulk Checklist to verify all connections and tank was ready to complete off load. Customer signed off before the off load. Customer and driver gave each other thumbs up from a distance. The driver thought that was an indication good to start the pump off. Shortly after driver started the pump, he heard a boom noise, exited the truck and noticed the product Ieaking from the pump. He imniediately turned off the pump. The customer notified his team and the product was contained and cleaned on site immediately. The cause of the release was determined to be the customer had not released the internal valve and water in the dyke area causing deadhead back to the pump. Univar maintenance and Vendor maintenance determined the vibration and stress caused a crack in suction pipe into pump causing the leak. The crack was welded and further tests on pipe and pump resulted in no further leaks or releases.

item.title: Report I-2024030014
item.description:
Report I-2024030014

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-19
  • City: Lynchburg
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLI TRANSPORT, LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Company Fuel Driver was making a fuel delivery at store at 09:03am, the driver had two hoses of connected from the trailer belly valves to the underground fuel storage tank(UST). Cones were in place to protect the area as well as lights activated for warnings. A white pickup truck(Super Duty) bearing Maryland registration# 9EC0549, pulling a - cement mixer trailer, disregarded the activated lights and orange security cones of our vehicle; drove over the hose fitting connected to the UST and tore the fitting and the lip of the UST off the tank. The hose attached to the trailer UST became stuck under the pickup truck. The driver exited their truck and removed the hose from under his truck; and left the scene immediately. Police report was filed with VA State Police(Trooper J.B. Moore) for truck"leaving th€ scene of the accident". Fuel driver managed to capture a photo of the truck that ran over the fitting and hoses and reported the incident to Law Enforcement and the Safety Department immediately. Material spilled was contained by the fuel driver using absorbent pads, and emptied the remaining fuel in the hose into the UST. No fuel contaminated the ground nor entered into any water systems.

  • Description: On 02/15/2024, during the boarding phase of flight DL2019, a passenger's carry-on bag in the overhead bin went into thermal runaway. The Flight Attendants heard a"pop" and saw flames in the overhead bin at row 11. Flight Attendants initiated an evacuation using the jetway. Customer removed the bag from the overhead and stepped on it to extinguish the fire. The flight attendants were on their way to retrieve the containment bag/water. ARFF responded, determined multi loose Li-ion batteries and coins arched and started the fire. No fire extinguisher or 02 masks were used. The affected overhead bin has no damage other than smoke soot residue. No Flight Attendant or customer injuries were reported. The NRC and FAA were notified.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver had the package inside the truck when a larger box from an upper shelf fell onto the hazmat package. Driver Left package up front at VSA, at which time QA responded and placed package inside red tote for transfer back to the cage. DescribePack: Box was wet on the outside. After inspection to figure out what fail, it came to the conclusion of a bad screw thread for one of the blue screw top bottles. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed on the side to prevent further leaking, than placed into a red tote and resealed the bottles on inspection

  • City: ROMULUS

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: CONTENTS OF AN AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA TO THE USA WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A STRONG ACETONE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS, ONE CONTAINER OF LUMELI REMOVEDOR DE ESMALTE TRANSLATED AS LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER WAS FOUND LEAKING. THE LEAK WAS CONTAINED WITHIN THE PACKAGE WITH JUST A SMALL STAIN ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY INSPECTED BY CUSTOMS OFFICIALS IN MIAMI PRIOR TO BEING RELEASED INTO THE UPS NETWORK. THERE IS "OPENED FOR CUSTOMS PURPOSES" TAPE SURROUNDING THE PACKAGE AND SURROUNDING THE LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE SCANS IN THE UPS NETWORK AS UPS SMALL PACKAGE TRACKING 1ZB6864V0423811919 BUT ALL THERMAL TRACKING LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE SHOW COLOMBIA NATIONAL POSTAL SERVICE, 4-72, TRACKING NUMBER CP0051323737CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA USING UPS ACCOUNT B6864V, ANICAM COLOMBIA SAS, TV 93 #53-32 BODEGA 13, PARQUE EMPRESARIAL EL DORADO, BOGOTA DC 110911 COLOMBIA.

  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum, and they deployed granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, PPE, and any cleanup debris was staged in the terminal's waste holding room along with the 85-gallon salvage drum that contained the damaged drum. All undamaged freight was staged on the dock for further handling by R+L personnel.

  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/14/2024 at 1812, personnel in the CSXT Acca Yard reported UTLX 210839, a loaded tank car of Alcohols N.O.S., was suspected to be leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Valero Marketing, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-02-14-00201). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, and Blaise MacDonald, a CSXT hazardous materials manager, were dispatched to the scene and found the manway cover was mis-aligned allowing the release; additionally, seven out of eight manway cover bolts were less than tool tight. Response personnel inspected the manway cover gasket and properly secured the manway cover for transportation. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Judy Watson 210-934-8157).

  • Description: Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX personnel in Williston, FL regarding the assistance with a (1) gallon spill of Sectagon K54 (UN3266,8,PG II). The product was released from a poly tote onto the trailer floor at a terminal. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Sectagon K54. Contractors were able to clean and neutralize the release with ABZORBIT PREMIUM ABSORBENT and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55- gallon poly drum which was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.description:

  • City: CHICKASHA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The transport was headed West on HWY 39 when the driver turned to enter the Enable Naples unload station, Crude Oil began to spill along side the trailer. The transport stopped and proceeded to call his supervisor. When the supervisor arrived, along with internal environmental personnel it was determined that driver was responsible for the spill. The driver did admit he had failed to close the fire valve and vent line valve on his trailer. The environmental clean up crew and local authorities were alerted. The environmental crew arrived at 7:53am. They spread powder absorbent on the highway and used a street sweeper to cleanup the residue. No waste was generated and no manifest produced for disposal. Work was completed at 8:33am. There was a local sheriff vehicle at the intersection at 5am but they left as soon as CRCT personnel arrived. No other authorities from Grady County were ever on site.

The residual product within the punctured tote was emptied and transferred to a new 330-gallon tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.   • City: DAVENPORT

  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was stopping at the end of his day and was completing the Post-trip inspection when noticed liquids drippings from trailer onto his tire at 1800. The driver grabed some absorbent to contain the liquid and called our emergency response at 1806. A team was dispatched out to address the release 1830. The crew arrived on scene at around 1900 and added more absorbents to provide a containment and monitoring. Equipment was need to gain access to the containers as the trailer was double stacked and full. The equipment was on scene by 0700 and unloading began. The container was reached by 0900 and found that there was a small dent in the bottom chime which a small hole was found. The material was cleaned up using absorbent pads and was disposed of per the proper requirements. The trailer was then reloaded and secured by around 1700 and driver was sent on his way.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was being off loaded from a trailer when it was dropped, and it landed upside down causing the tops of the containers to come loose and cause a slow leak from the containers. DescribePack: The tops of the containers are loose, and the box shows signs of a slow leak from the contents inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was discovered to be leaking the package was placed inside a hazmat tote and was placed inside the hazmat cage. Most of the liquid was confined to the box and ant liquid that came out was absorbed by cardboard that was placed down.

item.title: Report I-2024030016
item.description:
Report I-2024030016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: Willoughby
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. Leak was discovered coming from intermodal container (trailer), while staged at facility. Area was isolated and Willoughby Fire Department was dispatched to assess the site. Willoughby FD applied absorbent pads to the affected asphalt lot and deployed absorbent boom to nearby storm drains. Clean Harbors Environmental Services was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Clean Harbors Environmental applied additional absorbent material to the affected asphalt, inspected the nearby storm drain catch basins, and inspected the Ieaking trailer. Upon inspection, one 275gallon tote was discovered punctured at nose of trailer. Approximately 170 gallons of free product were released to the trailer floor, asphalt lot, and nearby storm drain catch basins. Clean Harbors Environmental proceeded to pH the impacted storm drains, which were returned neutral. Clean Harbors Environmental cleaned the trailer floor, wiped down adjacent freight, recovered spent absorbent material from the impacted asphalt, and emptied damaged tote. Two 55-gallon drums of free product, and 10 55-gallon drums of spent absorbent material and deanup debris were generated during the cleanup. Product was contained to an impervious surface and did not impact surface soils or state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was coming back to the station because it was unable to be delivered. The package was staged on the middle of the truck shelf, and it fell off causing the tops of bottles to come loose and the bottles leaked out. The driver immediately put down cardboard to soak up the spill and the box was placed inside a plastic tote and was returned to the station and placed inside the hazmat cage. All liquid which spilled inside the delivery truck was cleaned with old cardboard and was placed inside ethe salvage drum with the damaged product. DescribePack: The tops of the four bottles are missing and the inner seals of the containers are open from the fall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: cardboard was used to soak up all the spilled liquid and the bottles was turned right side up.
